titleStmt.title: དབུ་མ་རྩ་བའི་འགྲེལ་པ་ག་ལས་འཇིགས་མེད།
dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa ga las 'jigs med/
Mūlamadhyamaka­vṛtti­akutobhayā
A Running Commentary on “The Fundamental [Treatise on the] Middle Way,” called “Fearlessness From All”

bibl.author: Anon
bod kyi nu chen gyi lo tsA ba dge slong klu'i rgyal mtshan
Jñānagarbha

notesStmt.note: Some scholars assert that *Akutobhayā (ga las 'jigs med) should be taken as the name of the author of the commentary, although there is no explicit indication of this in the colophon to the text.

If *Akutobhayā (ga las 'jigs med) is to be taken as an ornamental title for the commentary, then the Tibetan would imply reading the Sanskrit as *akuto`bhayā = akutas + abhayā (“Fearlessness from all”). The colophon to the text states that the text is drawn from a single collection of earlier annotations (gna’ mchan) from eight authors: Nāgārjuna, Sthavīra Buddhapālita, Candrakīrti, Devaśarma, Gunaśrī, Gunamati, Sthiramati, and Bhaviveka. The colophon also praises Nāgārjuna in a variety of ways including as someone who displayed “utmost fearlessness from all those theses propounded as their own and others’ tenets” (rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i phyogs ga las kyang 'jigs pa med pa), which would seem to offer an explanation of akutobhayā (ga las 'jigs med) as an ornamental title.
